results.title: Doctor De Soto and 5 other funny stories
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s circle”.
A collection of animated short stories for children. “Doctor De Soto” by William Steig. The kind-hearted mouse Doctor De Soto is a dentist. He and his wife find a very clever way to treat a crafty fox, who comes to them with a sore tooth and secret thoughts of eating them after the job is done. This outstanding cartoon was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film. “Patrick” by Quentin Blake. When Patrick plays his fiddle, the countryside comes alive with vibrant colour and motion. “The Hat” by Tomi Ungerer. Penniless Benito finds good fortune when he comes upon a magic black hat with which he can perform fantastic feats. “Smile for Auntie” by Diane Paterson. Silly Auntie sings, dances, makes funny faces, stands on her head - anything to get the baby to smile! “The Foolish Frog” by Pete And Charles Seeger. Folk singer Pete Seeger plays and sings this catchy song about the frog who fell in the mud, to the delightful drawings of Mioslav Jagr. “Leopold the See-through Crumb-picker” by James Flora. Leopold is invisible and devours every crumb he finds, creating havoc in the process. See what happens when a little girl befriends him.

group_siblings.title: Where the wild things are and 5 other stories

results.title: Where the wild things are and 5 other stories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s circle”.
Where the wild things are is Maurice Sendak’s classic tale of Mischievous Max, who sails to where the wild things are and becomes their king. “The Nutshell Kids” features four delightful teaching poems set to music. “In the Night Kitchen” Little Mickey dreams of the kitchen at night where bakers bake cakes, dough aeroplanes fly and everyone dances to the deliciously syncopated music.
results.title_for_label: Where the wild things are and 5 other stories

results.title: Dandelion = Pusteblume
results.brief_description: A highly successful children’s series which was broadcast by the second German TV Channel. Peter Lustig, the protagonist in each episode deals with a new topic each time and provides an informative, educational insight into the subject with, of course, a funny and entertaining story running through it.

group_works.title: A Load of old rubbish; The World under our feet
A Pig in a rocking chair; Mermaids don't need snorkels
A roof over your head; Detective work in the woods

results.title: A Pig in a rocking chair; Mermaids don't need snorkels
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Dandelion = Pusteblume”.
Two more episodes of the popular German children’s series Pusteblume (Dandelion). ” A Pig in a rocking chair” - Peter Lustig would like a pig, but where can he keep it in such restricted quarters? On the veranda in the rocking chair? Peter takes a look at how animals are properly kept on a farm where there are cows in the meadow and dogs, cats and doves have their own little house. The farmer and his family look after all these animals, because they derive their livelihood from eventually selling the animals. “Mermaids don’t need snorkels” - If you want to observe animals underwater, then it is best to use a snorkel, since this will allow you to breathe under the water. For really deep diving, it is necessary to take a bottle of oxygen attached to your back in order to look at sunken ships or to do research.

group_siblings.title: A Load of old rubbish; The World under our feet
A roof over your head; Detective work in the woods

results.title: A Load of old rubbish; The World under our feet
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dandelion = Pusteblume”.
Two episodes of the successful German children’s series Pusteblume. “A Load of old rubbish” - Many old things are thrown away simply because people don’t know what else to do with them. Peter Lustig shows us ways to reuse many things. Something new can be made, toys can be exchanged when they are no longer a favourite and many waste products, like glass bottles, can be reused, as long as we don’t just throw them away. “The world under our feet” - Somewhere in every town, there is always some digging going on. Cars and trains travel underground in tunnels with multiple exits. When this happens, the earth gets pushed upwards, just like a mole hill which can be so annoying in the middle of your garden. However, people make even bigger hills when they go looking for coal, ores or salt in the earth, since all the earth that is excavated during mining has to be put somewhere.

A roof over your head; Detective work in the woods

results.title: A roof over your head; Detective work in the woods
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dandelion = Pusteblume”.
Two episodes of the successful children’s series Pusteblume. “A roof over your head” - People live in houses in order to protect themselves from the wind, rain, heat or cold. Peter Lustig experiences what can happen without a roof over one’s head. In addition, he shows us how people build new houses and how some animals build themselves a hideaway. “Tracks in the wood” - Peter Lustig finds lots of tracks made in the wood by animals who live there. Naturally, he also hears lots of different noises made by animals when they forage for food or creep through the undergrowth. People go into the woods too of course, to collect mushrooms or just to go for a walk. The forest ranger is really cross with those who rubbish the woods and damage the natural environment.

results.title: The Global warming. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Mark Redhead, Jean-Marc Seban, London Weekend Television and Vision Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Climate & man”.
Global Warming and the Greenhouse Effect are no longer unknown scientific concepts. They affect all people on the globe, and the prevention of further deterioration of the environment and atmosphere are critical issues facing governments. This comprehensive examination of the the causes and implications of greenhouse and global warming also looks at possible strategies which will in time slow down the devastation caused by these phenomena.

results.title: Understanding maternal grief
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description: A five part series introduced by Margaret Nicol, clinical psychologist and author which deals with distinct aspects of maternal grief. The programmes are dedicated to all women who have grieved over the loss of a baby and to the memory of those children. Each episode is designed to look at the experiences of women who have suffered different types of reproductive loss. The focus is on the need for the womens’ experiences to be validated and for the existence of the lost child to be acknowledged.

results.title: Loss of a baby: death of a dream
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
This program addresses the issue of women’s grief following a reproductive loss. Reproductive loss is seen to encompass miscarriage, stillbirth, neonatal death, the birth of a handicapped baby and infertility. The video incorporates dicussion of the major psychological aspects of maternal grief with Margaret Nicol (Psychologist) and Dr. Howard Chilton (Neonatologist), along with interviews with bereaved women. The four bereaved women describe their journey in grief over many years, presenting those experiences which were helpful and unhelpful in this process.
